body: Resolves YES if a credible news report confirms that Europe has met all three 2030 climate action goals AND humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe. Resolves NO otherwise.

title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030?
body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030. The landing itself of the human crew on Mars must occur before January 1, 2030, 00:00 UTC.
At least one person aboard the lander must survive the landing, however it is not necessary for the person to survive long-term or make a return trip to Earth, nor is it necessary for the mission to intend a return or long-term survival.
A "SpaceX-branded" mission is defined to mean that the SpaceX-associated logos on the spacecraft involved (both the boosters and the Mars-bound craft) have a larger surface area than the logos of any other entity

title: Before 2030, will SpaceX successfully land living human beings on Mars?
body: Resolves YES if a SpaceX-branded mission achieves the successful landing of one or more living human beings on Mars before January 1, 2030, 00:00 UTC. At least one person must survive the landing, without the requirement for long-term survival or return to Earth. The mission must bear larger SpaceX-associated logos on the spacecraft than any other entity involved.

title: If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
body:
Resolution Criteria
Zermelo's theorem says that only one of three possibilities is possible in a 2-player solved game; First player (white) wins, second player (black) wins, or there is a forced draw.
In the game of chess, these outcomes correspond to:
White wins
Black wins
Forced draw
If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
For the purpose of this question, chess is considered to be solved if
it is proved that white will win, lose or draw from the initial position, given perfect play on both sides
it is shown that there exists a unique result of perfect play from the initial position, which is either: white wins, black wins, or forced draw
Resolution is by publication of peer-reviewed article that is not shown to be mistaken for at least 3 years post-publication.
For the purpose of this question, the 50-move rule does not force a draw. Games that don't end, are considered drawn, for the purpose of this question
This question resolves ambiguously if the question does not resolve before Jan 1st, 2080.

title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning, will Kessler syndrome occur before 2050?
body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 or if perfect play does not result in white winning. If chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning, then resolves YES if Kessler syndrome will occur before 2050 and NO if it will not occur before 2050.

title: If chess is solved before 2080 and will Kessler syndrome occur before 2050?
body: Resolves YES if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050. Resolves NO otherwise.

title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050, will a human-made spaceship enter the Venusian atmosphere before 2030?
body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND Kessler syndrome does not occur before 2050. If the conditions are met (if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050), then resolves YES if a human-made spaceship enters the Venusian atmosphere before 2030, otherwise resolves NO.

title: If chess is solved before 2080 and Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050, will a human-made spaceship enter the Venusian atmosphere before 2030?
body: Resolves YES if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050 AND a human-made spaceship enters Venus's atmosphere before 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.
